greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Given a list of ternary numbers, interpret each as a ternary modular Gray code number, then convert to decimal.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: a(9) = 13 since Ternary 100 (9 decimal) interpreted as Ternary Gray code = 13.
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(v=digits(n,3)); for(i=2,#v, v[i]=(v[i]+v[i-1])%3); fromdigits(v,3); \\ _Kevin Ryde_, May 23 2020
xref: Cf. A105530 (inverse), A128173 (ternary reflected), A006068 (binary), A226134 (decimal modular), A007089.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 11 2005
ext: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Feb 09 2012
Comments by Gary W. Adamson moved to A105530 where they better apply. - _Kevin Ryde_, May 30 2020
